description.narrative: Insatsen utgör ett budgetstöd till Sarajevo Open Centers strategiska plan för 2014-2017. Sarajevo Open Center har under de senaste fyra åren intagit en ledande roll i kampen för mänskliga rättigheter i Bosnien och Hercegovina, med särkild inriktning på LGBT rättighter och kvinnors rättigheter. Organisationen arbetar med uppföljning och dokumentation av övergrepp, att ta fram en årsrapport om kvinnors situation i landet, utbildning av tjänstemän, poliser och militärer i LGBT rättigheter och ett informellt utbildningsprogram för juridikstuderande, journalister och lärare. Organisationen arbetar också med medvetandegörande insatser, juridisk rådgivning, social mobilisering, organisationsutveckling och nätverkande.

The contribution is a core support the Sarajevo Open Center's strategic plan for 2014-2017. Sarajevo Open Center has for the last four years reached a leading role in the search for human rights in Bosnia and Hercegovina, with a special focus on LGBT rights and women's rights. The organisation works with follow-up and documentation of human rights abuses, it compiles an annual report on women's situations in the country, trains public officers, policemen and military in LGBT rights and carries out an informal trainingprogram for law students, journalists and teachers. The organisation also works with advocacy, legal advisory, community mobilisation and institutional development and networking.

The human rights situation of LGBT people and women in Bosnia and Herzegovina has improved.- LGBT people are socially and legally empowered- BiH authorities have increased responsiveness to guarantee human rights of LGBT people and women- LGBT and women's rights are mainstreamed in public

description.narrative: Sarajevo Open Centre (SOC) is truly a unique organisation in Bosnia and Hercegovina in their fight for Human Rights for LGBT people and women at large. Their involvement against Homophobia and Transphobia has been recognized by many. Though there has been setbacks, not surprising due to quite a resistent society there has been many achievements too. SOC has managed to stage protest actions which got a lot of attention, not at least during 2017. The continued work related to EU accession process and to ensure EU integration are vital. SOC's work in relation to women's rights also gained ground not at least with the wok aimed to positively influence the Parliament (Federation level) in a more favorable way. Using different media platforms, SOC have managed to contribute to a wider knowledge about the issue at hand, and the role and rights of LGBT people. The Pink Reports submitted has been interesting and useful to read. Working with Parliamentary committees and the institutional frameworks of BiH as well as with the Gender Equality Agency cooperation has proven useful and building stronger networks around the country. An external evaluation was done in 2017 where the programme was evaluated in depth in a very comprehensive and positive way and which ample shows many of the successed achieved since the inception of the project start in 2015.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
